lines.content: - **What I Asked:** I provided my existing `README.md` file for the ByteBuddy project and asked for improvements to make it more polished, beginner-friendly, and professional.
- Suggested adding new sections: *Features*, *Demo (screenshot placeholder)*, *Development Notes*, *Contributing*, and *License*.
- Reorganized and reworded setup instructions for better clarity.
- Proposed improvements to formatting (icons, headings, code blocks).
- Ensured the README explains GUI-only interaction and Gradle build usage.
- Worked well for restructuring content and suggesting professional conventions commonly seen in open-source projects.
- AI saved significant time (~1‚Äì2 hours) compared to manually drafting and refining wording.
- Needed minor edits afterwards to tailor wording and confirm technical accuracy (e.g., Gradle tasks, project folder paths).
- **Overall Benefit:** Helped produce a more professional and comprehensive README in a fraction of the time.
ByteBuddy is a **Java chatbot** inspired by the Java mascot _Duke_.
It comes with a clean **JavaFX graphical interface (GUI)** for chatting with your personal task assistant.
- ‚úÖ Mark and unmark tasks as done
- üéâ Loads with sample data on first run to get you started
*(If you are not on the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close any open project.)*
- Accept any prompts with default options.
Once ByteBuddy is running, you can interact with it through natural commands.
Here are all the commands you can use:
1. **`list`** ‚Äì Lists all tasks currently in your task list.
4. **`event <description> /from <date time (yyyy-mm-dd HHmm)> /to <date time (yyyy-mm-dd HHmm)>`** ‚Äì Adds an Event task with a start and end time.
5. **`mark <task number>`** ‚Äì Marks a task as done.
6. **`unmark <task number>`** ‚Äì Marks a task as not done.
üí° Tip: You can type `help` anytime in the app to bring up this command list again.
- All interaction now happens via the **GUI** (CLI `run()` is deprecated).
- A GitHub Actions workflow (`.github/workflows/ci.yml`) is included for **CI/CD** ‚Äì it builds and tests the project on every commit/PR.
- To package a runnable JAR with JavaFX included:

E | 0 | project meeting | Aug 06 2019 14:00 to Aug 06 2019 18:00
ByteBuddy is a simple **Java chatbot task manager** that helps you track, organize, and manage your tasks efficiently.
It supports **Todos**, **Deadlines**, and **Events**, and allows you to mark, unmark, delete, find tasks, and more.
It comes with a clean **JavaFX graphical interface (GUI)** for chatting with your personal task assistant.
- ‚úÖ Mark and unmark tasks as done
- üéâ Loads with sample data on first run to get you started
*(If you are not on the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close any open project.)*
- Accept any prompts with default options.
Once ByteBuddy is running, you can interact with it through natural commands.
Here are all the commands you can use:
1. **`list`** ‚Äì Lists all tasks currently in your task list.
4. **`event <description> /from <date time (yyyy-mm-dd HHmm)> /to <date time (yyyy-mm-dd HHmm)>`** ‚Äì Adds an Event task with a start and end time.
5. **`mark <task number>`** ‚Äì Marks a task as done.
6. **`unmark <task number>`** ‚Äì Marks a task as not done.
üí° Tip: You can type `help` anytime in the app to bring up this command list again.
List all tasks currently in your list.
This shows type, status, description, and extra info for all tasks.
Here are the tasks in your list:
E | 0 | project meeting | 17 Sep 2025 14:00 to 17 Sep 2025 16:00
Add a **todo task** with only a description.
The task will appear in your list with type `T` and status `0` (not done) or `1` (done).
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 1 task in the list.
Add a **deadline task** with a description and due date.
The task will appear in your list with its type (`D`), status `0` (not done) or `1` (done),
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 2 tasks in the list.
Add an **event task** with a description,
The task will appear in your list with type `E`, status `0` (not done) or `1` (done),
description, and the start datetime, and end datetime.
Got it. I've added this task:
E | 0 | project meeting | 17 Sep 2025 14:00 to 17 Sep 2025 16:00
Now you have 3 tasks in the list.
Mark a task as **done** by its task number.
The task‚Äôs status will change to `1`.
Nice! I've marked this task as done:
Mark a task as **not done** by its task number.
The task‚Äôs status will revert to `0`.
OK, I've marked this task as not done yet:
Remove a task from your list by its task number.
E | 0 | project meeting | 17 Sep 2025 14:00 to 17 Sep 2025 16:00
Now you have 2 tasks in the list.
Search for tasks containing a keyword.
Matching tasks are displayed with their type, status, description, and extra info.
Here are the matching tasks in your list:
Bye. Hope to see you again soon!
Display a list of all available commands and their usage.
Here are some commands you can use:
event <description> /from <yyyy-mm-dd HHmm> /to <yyyy-mm-dd HHmm> - Adds an event task
mark <task number> - Marks a task as done
unmark <task number> - Marks a task as not done
find <keyword> - Finds tasks containing the keyword
- All interaction now happens via the **GUI** (CLI `run()` is deprecated).
- A GitHub Actions workflow (`.github/workflows/ci.yml`) is included for **CI/CD** ‚Äì it builds and tests the project on every commit/PR.
- To package a runnable JAR with JavaFX included:
* Represents the main ByteBuddy chatbot application.
* This class is responsible for initializing the application, handling user input,
* executing commands, and managing the task list.
/** Default file path for storing tasks. */
/** Handles storage and retrieval of tasks from disk. */
/** The list of tasks currently managed by the application. */
/** Handles user interaction, including input and output. */
* Constructs a new ByteBuddy chatbot instance.
* @param filePath the file path to load and save tasks
* Generates a response for the user's chat message.
// Instead of printing, let Command return a response String
* Represents a command that adds a {@link Task} to the {@link TaskList}.
* When executed, this command inserts the specified task into the task list
* and returns a confirmation message generated by the {@link Ui}.
/** The task to be added to the task list. */
* Creates a new {@code AddCommand} with the given task.
* @param task The task to add. Must not be {@code null}.
assert task != null : "Task should not be null";
* Executes the add command by inserting the stored task into the given
* task list, then returns a confirmation message from the UI.
* @param storage The storage handler (not used by this command).
* @param tasks   The task list to which the task will be added.
* @param ui      The UI component used to generate the confirmation message.
* @return A string message confirming that the task has been added.
public String execute(Storage storage, TaskList tasks, Ui ui) {
* Represents a command that terminates the application.
* When executed, this command signals that the program should exit
* and returns a farewell message generated by the {@link Ui}.
* This command is marked as an exit command by passing {@code true}
* This does not modify storage or the task list. Instead, it returns
* a farewell message to the user through the {@link Ui}.
* @param storage The storage handler (unused for this command).
* @param tasks   The task list (unused for this command).
* @param ui      The UI component that provides the farewell message.
* @return A string containing the farewell message.
public String execute(Storage storage, TaskList tasks, Ui ui) {
* Represents an abstract command in the ByteBuddy chatbot application.
* Commands encapsulate user actions, such as adding tasks, marking tasks,
* or exiting the application. Each command defines how it should be executed
/** Indicates whether this command will cause the application to exit. */
* @param isExit {@code true} if this command signals program termination,
* Implementations may modify the task list, interact with storage, and/or
* return messages generated by the UI.
* @param storage The storage handler for saving/loading tasks.
* @param tasks   The list of tasks the command operates on.
* @param ui      The UI component for generating user-facing messages.
* @return A string message describing the outcome of the command.
public abstract String execute(Storage storage, TaskList tasks, Ui ui);
* Represents a command that deletes a task from the task list.
* The {@code DeleteCommand} takes in a user-provided task index as a string,
* validates it, and removes the corresponding task if valid.
* It returns appropriate feedback messages via the {@link Ui}.
/** The user input specifying the index of the task to delete. */
* Constructs a {@code DeleteCommand} with the given body.
* @param body the string input representing the task index to delete
* If the body is empty, invalid, or out of range, an error message is returned.
* Otherwise, the task at the given index is removed from the {@link TaskList}.
* @param storage the storage manager (not modified by this command)
* @param tasks   the current list of tasks
* @param ui      the user interface for formatting feedback messages
* @return a feedback message for the user about the result of the operation
public String execute(Storage storage, TaskList tasks, Ui ui) {
assert removed != null : "Task should not be null";
return ui.getErrorMessage("Error: Please provide a valid task number to delete.");
* Represents a command that searches for tasks containing a given keyword.
* The {@code FindCommand} filters the existing {@link TaskList} for tasks
* that match the specified keyword. If no keyword is provided, a
/** The keyword to search for within the task descriptions. */
* Constructs a {@code FindCommand} with the given search keyword.
* @param keyword the keyword to search for in tasks
* If the keyword is empty, a {@link MissingDescriptionException} is thrown.
* Otherwise, it returns a formatted list of all matching tasks.
* @param storage the storage manager (not modified by this command)
* @param tasks   the current list of tasks
* @param ui      the user interface for formatting feedback messages
* @return a feedback message listing tasks that match the keyword
* @throws MissingDescriptionException if the keyword is empty
public String execute(Storage storage, TaskList tasks, Ui ui) {
* Represents a command that displays the help message to the user.
* When executed, this command provides a list of available commands
* and their usage instructions through the {@link Ui}.
* This command is marked as an exit command in the parent {@link Command} class,
* allowing the program to treat it as a command that may change application flow.
* This does not modify the task list or storage. It simply returns
* the formatted help message from the {@link Ui}.
* @param storage the storage manager (unused for this command)
* @param tasks   the current task list (unused for this command)
* @param ui      the user interface for displaying the help message
* @return a string containing the help message
public String execute(Storage storage, TaskList tasks, Ui ui) {
* Represents a command that lists all tasks in the current {@link TaskList}.
* When executed, this command retrieves all tasks and formats them
* into a message via the {@link Ui}.
* This command does not cause the application to exit, so {@code isExit} is set to {@code false}.
* Returns a formatted string containing all tasks in the {@link TaskList}.
* @param storage the storage manager (unused for this command)
* @param ui      the user interface for generating the task list message
* @return a string containing all tasks in the list
public String execute(Storage storage, TaskList tasks, Ui ui) {
* Represents a command that marks a task as done in the {@link TaskList}.
* The task to mark is identified by its index in the list. If the index is
* invalid, an error message is returned instead.
/** The index of the task to mark as done (0-based). */
* Constructs a {@code MarkCommand} for the specified task index.
* @param taskIndex the index of the task to mark as done
* Marks the task at the specified index as done. If the index is invalid,
* returns an error message. Uses the {@link Ui} to format feedback messages.
* @param storage the storage manager (not modified by this command)
* @param ui      the user interface for generating messages
* @return a string message confirming the task was marked, or an error message
public String execute(Storage storage, TaskList tasks, Ui ui) {
assert t != null : "Task should not be null";
* Represents a command that is executed when the user input is not recognized.
* The {@code UnknownCommand} provides an error message guiding the user
* to enter 'help' to see the list of available commands.
* This command is marked as an exit command in the parent {@link Command} class,
* allowing the application to treat it as a command that may influence program flow.
* Returns an error message indicating that the command was not recognized,
* and suggests using the 'help' command to view available commands.
* @param storage the storage manager (unused by this command)
* @param tasks   the current task list (unused by this command)
* @param ui      the user interface for generating the error message
* @return a string containing the error message for unknown commands
public String execute(Storage storage, TaskList tasks, Ui ui) {
return ui.getErrorMessage("Unknown command.\nPlease enter 'help' to see the list of available commands.");
* Represents a command that marks a task as not done in the {@link TaskList}.
* The task to unmark is identified by its index in the list. If the index is
* invalid, an error message is returned instead.
/** The index of the task to mark as not done (0-based). */
* Constructs an {@code UnmarkCommand} for the specified task index.
* @param taskIndex the index of the task to mark as not done
* Marks the task at the specified index as not done. If the index is invalid,
* returns an error message. Uses the {@link Ui} to format feedback messages.
* @param storage the storage manager (not modified by this command)
* @param ui      the user interface for generating messages
* @return a string message confirming the task was unmarked, or an error message
public String execute(Storage storage, TaskList tasks, Ui ui) {
assert t != null : "Task should not be null";
super("The description of a " + taskType +  " cannot be empty.");
super("Please enter 'help' to see the list of available commands.");

* Handles reading and writing tasks to the disk.

return new Event(parts[2], from, to, isDone);

* Represents a generic task in ByteBuddy.
* A task stores a description, its completion status,
* Subclasses such as {@link Todo}, {@link Deadline}, and {@link Event}

* Creates a new task with an explicit completion status.
* @param description The description of the task
* @param taskType    The type of the task
* @param isDone      Whether the task is already marked as done
public Task(String description, TaskType taskType, boolean isDone) {
assert description != null : "Task description should not be null";
* Returns a string representation of the task's completion status.

return (isDone ? "1" : "0"); // mark done task with X

* Provides methods to add, remove, retrieve, and update tasks.

* Returns an iterator over the tasks in this list.
* Returns the symbol representing the type of this task.
* Each {@link TaskType} has a short symbol used for display or storage:
* @return the string symbol associated with this {@link TaskType}
* Represents a to-do task in ByteBuddy.
